answerText: Icelandic sagas[10] One famous saga is about this facial hair lacking friend of Gunnar, who is burned in his house as revenge for his son Skarp-hedin's killing of Thrain Sigfusson.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Illinois A, Alabama, Yale B | 13 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  [10] Name these Medieval Icelandic works of literature which mostly describe historical events that occurred some three centuries before they were written.
